questions.text: What band—none of whose members were actually related to one another—first hit the Billboard Top 100 in 1977 with the song “Sheena is a Punk Rocker”?
If you've spent the day driving around Peach Beach, Banshee Boardwalk, and Rainbow Road, you're playing an installment of what video game franchise?
“Selenology” is defined as the scientific study of the… what?
Which Caribbean nation has a name that translates to English as “the bearded ones?
What term for a day of special significance dates back to the days of the Roman Republic, when a certain color ink was used to mark these days on the calendar?

rounds.title: Stay Cool
rounds.round_description: Get into these five cool questions.

questions.text: Jimmy Cliff’s cover of the song “I Can See Clearly Now” hit the charts in 1993 after it was used in what movie—a wildly fictionalized retelling of the 1988 Winter Olympics in Calgary?
What ‘90s rapper, who has desperately been trying to keep his trademark braids despite going bald in recent years, performed the theme song for the TV show “Kenan and Kel”?
What character actor, who also appeared in “American Pie,” is so recognizable for her role in “Legally Blonde” that she reprised it in 2018 for Ariana Grande’s “thank u, next” video?
What snack food, originally available only in “Toasted Corn” flavor, sells one of its most popular flavors in much of Europe under the branding “Cool American”?
“What we’ve got here is failure to communicate” is No. 11 on the American Film Institute’s list of the “100 Greatest Movie Quotes of All Time.” It’s a line from what movie?

rounds.title: Where Do You Pronounce It Like That?
rounds.round_description: I'll describe two homographs--words that are spelled the same but pronounced differently. At least one of them will be a place name. You write down the word.

questions.text: A city on the French Riviera, or pretty cool.
A fancy street in Beverly Hills, or a showcase for cowboys and cowgirls.
The capital of Peru, or another name for a butter bean.
A city in Texas, or a street in New York.
A mountain in Washington, or what the Pacific Northwest is, compared to the Southwest.
Name this person.
Name this person.
Name this person.
Name this person.
Name this character.
Name this person.
Name this person.
Name this character.
Name this thing.
Name this person.

rounds.title: The Rainbow Flag
rounds.round_description: Happy Pride Month! Here are five questions about the iconic Pride Flag.

questions.text: Designer Gilbert Baker created the Pride flag in 1978. Its rainbow originally included the color pink, but it was eventually dropped due to pink fabric being more expensive than the other colors. How many stripes are now in the standard Pride flag?
The “Progress Pride Flag,” designed by Daniel Quasar in 2018, adds black, brown, light blue, light pink, and white to the classic rainbow flag in what shape?
The White House was illuminated in rainbow flag colors following the Supreme Court ruling on Obergefell v. Hodges in 2015. What was the impact of that decision?

Lena Waithe made a splash in 2018 when she wore a cope—that’s a liturgical cape worn by a Catholic bishop—made out of a rainbow flag to what annual event, whose theme that year was “Fashion and the Catholic Imagination”?
A large Pride flag flies year-round at the corner of Market and Castro streets in San Francisco, over a plaza named after what politician?

rounds.title: It’s Independence Day Somewhere
rounds.round_description: I’ll name a country other than the United States that celebrates an Independence Day. You tell me which colonial power they gained independence from.

questions.text: June 30, 1960: Democratic Republic of the Congo
January 1, 1804: Haiti
December 6, 1917: Finland
July 28, 1821: Peru
August 15, 1947: India
What classic American game show, often parodied on “RuPaul’s Drag Race,” was replicated in the U.K. and Australia under the name “Blankety Blanks”?
What vehicle brand takes its name from the Italian word for “wasp”?
What Germanic tribe sacked Rome in 455, and had a name that lives on today as a word that describes people who participate in the destruction of property?
Brass is an alloy of copper and zinc. Bronze is an alloy of copper and… what?

What theatrical performance, which has been seen live by more than 25 million people worldwide, began in 1994 as a 7-minute interlude during the Eurovision Song Contest that told the history of Irish immigration to America?

rounds.title: Retro Vibes
rounds.round_description: Clips from five songs that have gone viral on TikTok recently, despite being more than 10 years old.

questions.text:
“There were nights of endless pleasure / 
It was more than all your laws allow / 
Baby, baby, baby / 
When you touch me like this / 
And when you hold me like that”
questions.answer: Celine Dion, “It’s All Coming Back to Me Now”

questions.text:
“If I only could / 
I'd make a deal with God / 
And I'd get him to swap our places / 
Be running up that road”

“We were as one, babe / 
For a moment in time / 
And it seemed everlasting / 
That you would always be mi–”

“Last night, I was taking a walk along the river / 
And I saw him together with a young girl / 
And the look that he gave her made me shiver / 
'Cause he always used to look at me that way”

“I'm not a perfect person / 
There's many things I wish I–”
